responses.content:
```yaml
leads:
  - headline: "Potential Cross-Site Scripting (XSS) vulnerability in HTML sanitization"
    analysis: |
      The code uses the bleach library to sanitize HTML input with a predefined set of allowed tags and attributes. However, the configuration may still be prone to Cross-Site Scripting (XSS) vulnerabilities if the list of allowed tags and attributes is insufficiently restrictive. Certain HTML tags and attributes can be manipulated to execute malicious scripts if not properly filtered. Security researchers should investigate specific edge cases of HTML elements that could be exploited under the current sanitization settings and develop Proof of Concept (POC) exploits to demonstrate these vulnerabilities.
    cwe: CWE-79
    function_names: []
    filenames:
      - benchmarks/bleach_bench.py
    classification: very promising
```

leads.headline: Potential Cross-Site Scripting (XSS) vulnerability in HTML sanitization
leads.analysis: The code uses the bleach library to sanitize HTML input with a predefined set of allowed tags and attributes. However, the configuration may still be prone to Cross-Site Scripting (XSS) vulnerabilities if the list of allowed tags and attributes is insufficiently restrictive. Certain HTML tags and attributes can be manipulated to execute malicious scripts if not properly filtered. Security researchers should investigate specific edge cases of HTML elements that could be exploited under the current sanitization settings and develop Proof of Concept (POC) exploits to demonstrate these vulnerabilities.
